data.title: Alan Lascelles
data.meta_description: After attending Marlborough College, followed by Trinity College, Oxford, Lascelles served in France with the Bedfordshire Yeomanry. He rose to the rank of captain and was awarded the Military Cross, after which he became aide-de-camp to his brother-in-law Lord Lloyd, the Governor of Bombay. He...
data.text: After attending Marlborough College, followed by Trinity College, Oxford, Lascelles served in France with the Bedfordshire Yeomanry. He rose to the rank of captain and was awarded the Military Cross, after which he became aide-de-camp to his brother-in-law Lord Lloyd, the Governor of Bombay. He then returned to Saxon and began serving as Assistant Private secretary to Edward Oswalt lll. After the king died, he left and he became Secretary to the Governor General of Canada, Vere Ponsonby, 9th Earl of Bessborough. He then returned once more to Saxon and was appointed private secretary to the kings mother until she wanted him to be the prince of Kareliaâ€™s private secretary. he was then appointed private secretary once more to the Prince of Karelia. He is also the royal archives keeper.
